activities.name: Lille International Market
activities.description: Experience one of Europe's largest street markets as Lille's city center transforms into a massive international bazaar with vendors from across Europe selling crafts, food, and unique products.
activities.seasonal_notes: This April/May event brings hundreds of traders and thousands of visitors to Lille's streets, creating a festive atmosphere throughout the city center.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required. Arrive early morning to avoid the biggest crowds and find the best selection. Bring cash as not all vendors accept cards.

activities.name: Wazemmes Flower Market
activities.description: Visit the vibrant Wazemmes Market when the flower stalls burst with color and seasonal blooms, offering everything from cut flowers to garden plants and botanical specialties.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring brings an explosion of tulips, daffodils, and local seasonal flowers to this historic market, particularly spectacular on Sunday mornings.
activities.booking_tips: Visit early Sunday morning (before 10am) for the best selection and most pleasant shopping experience.

activities.name: Series Mania Festival
activities.description: Attend this international television festival featuring premieres, meet-and-greets with creators and actors, and screenings of upcoming series from around the world.
activities.seasonal_notes: This March festival transforms Lille into the capital of TV series with events at multiple venues including Le Nouveau Siècle and Tripostal.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets for popular screenings and master classes online in advance. Many public screenings are free but require reservation.

activities.name: Citadelle Park Bloom
activities.description: Explore Lille's largest park as it comes alive with spring blooms, offering perfect picnic spots, jogging paths, and boat rentals on the canal.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring brings lush greenery and flowering trees to this 60-hectare park built around Vauban's star-shaped fortress.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required. Rent a rowboat at the small dock near the zoo entrance for a peaceful exploration of the park's waterways.

activities.name: Guided Tour of Lille's Secret Gardens
activities.description: Discover hidden courtyards and private gardens of Vieux-Lille that open to the public only during spring, revealing architectural and botanical treasures behind historic facades.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring is the only time to access many of these private spaces, with special permission granted during 'Rendez-vous aux Jardins' events in late May/early June.
activities.booking_tips: Book through the Lille Tourism Office at least one week in advance as tour groups are kept small to respect the private nature of these spaces.

activities.name: Lille Piano Festival
activities.description: Experience this prestigious piano festival featuring world-class performers in various venues across the city, from the Opéra de Lille to intimate historic spaces.
activities.seasonal_notes: This spring event brings together classical and jazz piano virtuosos for performances in some of Lille's most beautiful architectural settings.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets at least one month in advance for popular recitals. Consider the festival pass for access to multiple performances at better value.

activities.name: Cycling the Canal de la Deûle
activities.description: Enjoy a spring bicycle ride along the scenic Canal de la Deûle path, extending from Lille to the neighboring towns through blooming countryside and industrial heritage sites.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring weather is perfect for cycling this flat, easy route with wildflowers blooming along the canal banks and outdoor cafés opening for the season.
activities.booking_tips: Rent V'Lille bikes from stations throughout the city or book a guided cycling tour through the tourism office for historical context.

activities.name: Beer Workshop at Célestin
activities.description: Learn about regional brewing traditions in a hands-on workshop at a Lille craft brewery, creating your own beer with springtime ingredients and local expertise.
activities.seasonal_notes: Workshops in spring often feature seasonal ingredients like local honey, spring herbs, and special yeasts that flourish in warmer weather.
activities.booking_tips: Book at least two weeks in advance as classes are small. Your custom-brewed beer will be ready for pickup or shipping several weeks after the workshop.

activities.name: Le Printemps de l'Art Déco
activities.description: Participate in this regional Art Deco festival with special exhibitions, building tours, and events highlighting the rich Art Deco heritage of Lille and surrounding cities.
activities.seasonal_notes: This March-June event spans the entire Hauts-de-France region, with Lille hosting special exhibitions and opening normally private Art Deco buildings.
activities.booking_tips: Check the festival program online and book guided tours of specific buildings in advance, as many have limited capacity.

activities.name: Lille Plage (Lille Beach)
activities.description: Experience urban beach life at this summer installation featuring imported sand, palm trees, loungers, and water activities along the banks of the Deûle river and at various city locations.
activities.seasonal_notes: This July-August event transforms areas of the city into beachfront spaces, with recreational activities, food stalls, and cultural performances.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required. Arrive early to secure loungers, especially on weekends. Check the city's website for specific activities each day.

activities.name: Fête Nationale Celebrations
activities.description: Join Lille's Bastille Day celebrations on July 14th with the traditional military parade, spectacular fireworks display, and public dances in the city center.
activities.seasonal_notes: This patriotic celebration brings locals and visitors together for one of France's most important national holidays.
activities.booking_tips: For best fireworks viewing, find a spot along the Champ de Mars or near the Citadelle. Arrive several hours early for prime locations.

activities.name: Open-Air Cinema at Gare Saint Sauveur
activities.description: Enjoy free film screenings under the stars at this converted railway station that now serves as a cultural center with an outdoor cinema during summer evenings.
activities.seasonal_notes: The summer film program features classics, independent films, and family-friendly options in this unique post-industrial setting.
activities.booking_tips: No formal booking required, but arrive at least an hour early to secure a good spot. Bring a blanket or cushion for comfort on the ground seating.

activities.name: Les Jeudis du Jazz
activities.description: Experience free open-air jazz concerts every Thursday evening in various squares throughout Lille, showcasing local talent and international performers.
activities.seasonal_notes: This summer concert series takes advantage of Lille's long summer evenings with performances that often continue until 10pm or later.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required. Check the city's cultural program for weekly locations, which rotate between Grand Place, Place Rihour, and other public squares.

activities.name: Guinguette de la Marine
activities.description: Visit this seasonal waterside bar and restaurant along the Deûle canal, offering outdoor dining, cocktails, and weekend live music in a festive atmosphere.
activities.seasonal_notes: This summer pop-up venue recreates the traditional French riverside 'guinguette' experience with a modern twist.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve tables for dinner in advance, especially for weekend evenings. Walk-ins are usually accommodated for drinks only seating.

activities.name: Wazemmes l'Accordéon Festival
activities.description: Celebrate the accordion at this quirky neighborhood festival featuring concerts, street performances, dances, and workshops dedicated to this traditional instrument with modern interpretations.
activities.seasonal_notes: This unique June festival brings together traditional French music with global accordion traditions in the multicultural Wazemmes district.
activities.booking_tips: Most street performances are free, but book tickets for headliner concerts at venues like the Maison Folie Wazemmes in advance.

activities.name: Paddleboarding on the Deûle
activities.description: Try stand-up paddleboarding on the calm waters of the Deûle canal, offering a unique perspective of Lille's waterfront landscapes and architectural landmarks.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer provides ideal conditions with gentle waters and pleasant temperatures for this increasingly popular water activity.
activities.booking_tips: Book equipment and beginner lessons through Grand Huit or other water sports providers at least 24 hours in advance.

activities.name: Lille Beer Festival
activities.description: Sample hundreds of local and international craft beers at this celebration of brewing culture, featuring tastings, food pairings, and brewing demonstrations.
activities.seasonal_notes: This summer event highlights the rich beer heritage of the region with a focus on traditional Flemish brewing techniques and modern craft innovations.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online before the event as they often sell out. Consider the VIP option for early entry and special tastings.

activities.name: LaM Summer Program
activities.description: Participate in the Lille Métropole Museum of Modern Art's special summer activities, including outdoor sculpture walks, evening events, and family workshops in their expansive sculpture garden.
activities.seasonal_notes: The museum extends hours during summer and hosts special outdoor installations and performances throughout their sculpture park.
activities.booking_tips: Book specialty workshops in advance through the museum website. The sculpture park is particularly beautiful in the evening light.

activities.name: Braderie de Lille
activities.description: Experience Europe's largest flea market, a massive 48-hour event where millions of visitors hunt for treasures among thousands of vendors spread throughout the city streets.
activities.seasonal_notes: This early September institution has been held for centuries, featuring antiques, second-hand goods, street food, and the famous mountain of mussel shells competition between restaurants.
activities.booking_tips: Book accommodation at least 6 months in advance. Arrive at dawn for serious antiquing, or mid-morning for a more relaxed experience among the crowds.

activities.name: Flemish Autumn Beer Festival
activities.description: Discover the region's harvest beers and seasonal brews at this specialized beer festival celebrating the rich brewing traditions of French Flanders and Belgium.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn marks the release of special seasonal beers including harvest ales, pumpkin beers, and the highly anticipated Bière de Garde varieties.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online at least two weeks in advance and download the festival app to plan your tasting route efficiently.

activities.name: Jazz en Nord Festival
activities.description: Attend performances at this respected jazz festival featuring international artists performing in intimate venues throughout Lille and neighboring towns.
activities.seasonal_notes: This October-November festival brings jazz performances to historical venues and theaters across the metropolitan area of Lille.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets for headliner acts at least a month in advance. Consider the festival pass for better value if attending multiple performances.

activities.name: Regional Cuisine Workshop
activities.description: Learn to prepare traditional Northern French dishes in a hands-on cooking class focused on autumn specialties and local seasonal ingredients.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn classes focus on hearty regional specialties like carbonnade flamande (beef and beer stew), potjevleesch (cold meat in jelly), and seasonal desserts with local apples and pears.
activities.booking_tips: Book at least two weeks in advance through cooking schools like Cook & Go or L'Atelier des Chefs. Morning classes typically include lunch with beer pairings.

activities.name: Route du Houblon (Hop Route)
activities.description: Explore the hop-growing countryside north of Lille during harvest season, visiting hop farms, rural breweries, and charming Flemish villages.
activities.seasonal_notes: September is hop harvest time, when the countryside is alive with activity and many farms open their doors to visitors for special tours and tastings.
activities.booking_tips: Book a guided tour with transportation or create a self-driving itinerary. Many farms require advance notice for visits during this busy harvest period.

activities.name: Festival International du Court Métrage
activities.description: Discover emerging filmmaking talent at Lille's International Short Film Festival, screening hundreds of short films from around the world in various venues across the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: This autumn festival transforms Lille into a showcase for innovative short-form filmmaking, with screenings organized by theme and genre.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase a festival pass for the best value, or book individual screening blocks that interest you. Some masterclasses and workshops require separate registration.

activities.name: Autumn Walks in Parc Mosaïc
activities.description: Experience the spectacular fall colors at this unique park featuring gardens representing different cultures, with special autumn activities and artistic installations.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings stunning foliage to this park in the Lille metropolitan area, with special programming focused on harvest traditions from around the world.
activities.booking_tips: Check the park's calendar for special events and guided tours. The park closes for winter in early November, making October visits ideal.

activities.name: Lille Photography Fair
activities.description: Browse exhibitions, meet photographers, and attend workshops at this art fair dedicated to contemporary photography and visual storytelling.
activities.seasonal_notes: This autumn event attracts photography enthusiasts and collectors with exhibitions held in various locations throughout the city.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online to avoid lines. Special workshops and portfolio reviews require separate registration well in advance.

activities.name: Allumoirs Festival
activities.description: Participate in this traditional northern French lantern procession where children parade through the streets with homemade lanterns ('allumoirs') singing traditional songs.
activities.seasonal_notes: This charming autumn tradition takes place in various neighborhoods throughout October and November, often coinciding with Saint Martin's Day celebrations.
activities.booking_tips: Check the city's cultural calendar for specific dates and neighborhoods. Lantern-making workshops are often held beforehand for visitors who wish to participate.

activities.name: Lille Christmas Market
activities.description: Experience the magic of Lille's Christmas Village in Place Rihour with over 90 chalets offering festive foods, artisanal crafts, and holiday decorations in a twinkling winter wonderland.
activities.seasonal_notes: From late November to December 30th, the market transforms the city center with lights, decorations, and the aromas of mulled wine and gingerbread.
activities.booking_tips: Visit on weekdays or early in the day on weekends to avoid the largest crowds. Evening visits offer the most magical atmosphere with all the lights illuminated.

activities.name: Palais des Beaux-Arts After Dark
activities.description: Visit Lille's renowned fine arts museum during its special winter evening openings, featuring themed tours, music performances, and illuminated displays.
activities.seasonal_notes: During winter months, the museum extends hours on Thursday evenings with special programming and a cozy café serving seasonal treats.
activities.booking_tips: Some specialty guided tours require advance booking through the museum website. The first Sunday of each month offers free entry.

activities.name: Winter Beer Tasting Tour
activities.description: Warm up with a guided tour of Lille's historic estaminets (traditional taverns) and modern craft breweries, sampling hearty winter beers and traditional snacks.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter is ideal for sampling the region's stronger, warming beers like Bière de Noël (Christmas beer) and aged varieties in cozy, historic settings.
activities.booking_tips: Book through the tourism office or specialized beer tour companies at least a week in advance. Tours run regardless of weather.

activities.name: Lille Patinoire (Ice Skating)
activities.description: Glide across the ice at Lille's seasonal outdoor skating rink in Place du Général de Gaulle, surrounded by historic architecture and festive decorations.
activities.seasonal_notes: From December through February, this temporary rink offers winter fun in the heart of the city, with special music nights and skating demonstrations.
activities.booking_tips: No advance booking needed. Skate rental is included in the entry fee. Weekday mornings are least crowded for beginners.

activities.name: Carnival de Wazemmes
activities.description: Experience this lively neighborhood carnival with colorful parades, music, dance performances, and traditional giant puppets celebrating the approach of spring.
activities.seasonal_notes: This February/March event brings color and warmth to the late winter, featuring distinctly northern French carnival traditions.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required. Check local listings for the exact parade route and timing, which changes slightly each year.

activities.name: Festival Séries Mania
activities.description: Attend one of Europe's premier television festivals featuring preview screenings of upcoming series, panel discussions with creators, and immersive experiences.
activities.seasonal_notes: This late winter festival (typically March) brings television industry professionals and fans together for screenings throughout the city.
activities.booking_tips: Many screenings are free but require online registration, which opens several weeks before the festival. Premium events with celebrities sell out quickly.

activities.name: Welsh Cooking Workshop
activities.description: Learn to prepare Lille's signature comfort food - the Welsh - a hearty beer and cheese dish perfect for cold winter days, along with other regional specialties.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter workshops focus on the hearty, warming dishes that define Northern French cuisine, with plenty of beer and cheese featuring prominently.
activities.booking_tips: Book classes through Le Traiteur de Lille or other cooking schools at least two weeks in advance. Most classes include tastings of multiple regional dishes.

activities.name: Musée de l'Hospice Comtesse by Candlelight
activities.description: Experience this historic museum in a magical atmosphere during special candlelit evening tours that bring the former hospital's medieval and Renaissance periods to life.
activities.seasonal_notes: These atmospheric winter tours offer a glimpse into the building's past with special lighting, storytelling, and occasionally period costumes.
activities.booking_tips: Book these specialty tours at least two weeks in advance as they have limited capacity and are only offered on select winter evenings.

activities.name: Lille International Short Film Festival
activities.description: Discover emerging cinematic talent at this festival showcasing hundreds of short films from around the world, with screenings, workshops, and director Q&As.
activities.seasonal_notes: This winter festival brings international filmmakers to Lille, with warm indoor theaters providing perfect refuge from cold winter days.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase a festival pass for the best value or tickets for specific screening programs. Some venues are small, so book popular programs in advance.
